document.heading: Parent-led Play Cooperative Amendment Act of 2018

To amend the Child Development Facilities Regulation Act of 1998 to differentiate between formal and informal parent-led play cooperatives, and to exempt parent-led play cooperatives from the requirements of the act.

history.summary: BILL SUMMARY - As introduced, this bill exempts parent-led play cooperatives from the requirements of the Child Development Facilities Regulation Act of 1998.

document.text: BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Parent-led Play Cooperative Amendment Act of 2018".

section.text: The Child Development Facilities Regulation Act of 1998, effective April 13, 1999 (D.C. Law12-215; D.C. Official Code § 7-2031 et seq.) is amended as follows:

para.text: Section 2 (D.C. Official Code § 7-2031), is amended as follows:
A new paragraph (3B) is added to read as follows:

A group of parents, step-parents, or legal guardians of participating children, including a group that has organized as a nonprofit organization, who have agreed to supervise the participating children during group meetings; and:
Meets at predetermined times for fewer than 4 hours per day;
Meets at locations other than a home of one of the parents, step-parents, or legal guardians in the group;
Does not require payment by parents, step-parents, or legal guardians, other than to cover the costs of administering the group, including rent, insurance, equipment, and activities;

Requires, as a prerequisite to joining the group, that a parent, step-parent, or legal guardian of each participating child in the group volunteer a minimum number of hours to supervise the participating children during meetings, regardless of whether the group requires parents, step-parents, or legal guardians of every child to be present at every meeting;

Notifies, upon registration with the group, the parents, step-parents, and legal guardians of each participating child in the group that the group is not a child development facility licensed pursuant to this act;

Does not employ any individual to supervise participating children on behalf of parents other than to facilitate activities while parents, step-parents, or legal guardians supervise the participating children; and
Has written policies and procedures for the prevention of the spread of infectious diseases, response to and prevention of food allergies, emergency preparedness, and handling of health information.
A new paragraph (4A) is added to read as follows:
A group of parents, step-parents, or legal guardians of participating children who gather together to allow children to play together; and
The group does not meet the definition of a formal parent-led play cooperative as defined in paragraph (3B) of this section.

section.heading: Fiscal impact statement.

section.heading: Effective date.
section.text: This act shall take effect following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council to override the veto), a 30-day period of congressional review as provided in section 602(c)(1) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Stat. 813; D.C. Official Code § 1-206.02(c)(1)), and publication in the District of Columbia Register.
